name: Mocha Chocolate Swirl in Vanilla Wheat Bread. Vegan
description: Its chocolate mocha and vanilla rolled together in a bread!
recipeIngredient: 2 teaspoons raw sugar (2 Tablespoons for sweeter. The bread has just a hint of sweetness with 2 tsps.)
1/4 cup vanilla almond milk or few drops of vanilla extract + non dairy milk/water
1 Tablespoon evoo or organic canola oil
1 Tablespoon instant coffee (skip for just chocolate layer)

recipeInstructions.text: In 2 medium bowls, add 1/4 cup warm water, raw sugar and yeast. Mix and let sit until frothy(10 minutes).
recipeInstructions.name: In 2 medium bowls, add 1/4 cup warm water, raw sugar and yeast. Mix and let sit until frothy(10 minutes).

recipeInstructions.text: Add the vanilla almond milk, oil to one bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the vanilla almond milk, oil to one bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the flours and salt and knead 5-6 minutes in stand mixer or 8-9 minutes by hand. Cover and let rise for 1.5 hours or until doubled.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the flours and salt and knead 5-6 minutes in stand mixer or 8-9 minutes by hand. Cover and let rise for 1.5 hours or until doubled.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the coffee, cocoa powder, almond milk, salt and oil well.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the coffee, cocoa powder, almond milk, salt and oil well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the flours and cocoa mixture to the yeast mixture in the other bowl and knead 5-6 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the flours and cocoa mixture to the yeast mixture in the other bowl and knead 5-6 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: You might need a little flour more or less depending on the flours used.
recipeInstructions.name: You might need a little flour more or less depending on the flours used.

recipeInstructions.text: Cover and let rise for 1.5 hours or until doubled.
recipeInstructions.name: Cover and let rise for 1.5 hours or until doubled.

recipeInstructions.text: Punch dough down, use a Tablespoon or so bread flour to help make the dough less sticky and knead for a few seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: Punch dough down, use a Tablespoon or so bread flour to help make the dough less sticky and knead for a few seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Pat or roll out the vanilla dough into a rectangle.
recipeInstructions.name: Pat or roll out the vanilla dough into a rectangle.

recipeInstructions.text: Roll out the mocha layer and place over the vanilla. (You can sprinkle a layer of chocolate chips on the vanilla layer before topping with the mocha layer)
recipeInstructions.name: Roll out the mocha layer and place over the vanilla. (You can sprinkle a layer of chocolate chips on the vanilla layer before topping with the mocha layer)

recipeInstructions.text: Roll up the layers like a tight jelly roll.
recipeInstructions.name: Roll up the layers like a tight jelly roll.

recipeInstructions.text: Seal the edges and place seam side down in a parchment lined bread pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Seal the edges and place seam side down in a parchment lined bread pan.

recipeInstructions.text: Spray water on top. Top liberally with oats.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray water on top. Top liberally with oats.

recipeInstructions.text: Cover with a towel and let rise until doubled(40-50 minutes)
recipeInstructions.name: Cover with a towel and let rise until doubled(40-50 minutes)

recipeInstructions.text: Bake in reheated 365 degrees F for 30-35 minutes until a tap on the top sounds hollow.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake in reheated 365 degrees F for 30-35 minutes until a tap on the top sounds hollow.

recipeInstructions.text: Let cool completely before slicing or storing. (Refrigerate for half an hour before slicing for clean less crumbly slices)
recipeInstructions.name: Let cool completely before slicing or storing. (Refrigerate for half an hour before slicing for clean less crumbly slices)
